Speaker: seventh draft
Dialogue: January 12, 1992  INT. REGIS & KATHIE LEE SHOW SET

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Can you imagine it, Regis, Kathie Lee? One day I'm a hot young movie star, and the next day I'm a hideous mutant freak, covered with festering lesions.

Speaker: regis
Dialogue: Sounds like my wife when she misses a mudpack!

Speaker: kathie lee
Dialogue: Oh Regis! You're incorrigible! Ha- ha!  Won't you tell us your story?

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Well, it's kinda long, but okay. It all started when I signed a deal to be spokesman for the E.E.S. conglomerate...

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: So, what kind of crap do you scumbags want me to peddle?

Speaker: hertz
Dialogue: Everything. Everything except shoes, of course. Hah hah...

Speaker: hertz
Dialogue: Meaty Twig Beef Sticks.

Speaker: hertz
Dialogue: Helmet Head hair spray.

Speaker: hertz
Dialogue: Noxon 24 biogenetic neuro- fertilizer.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Fertilizer? Ricky Coogan does not do ads for hi-tech cow shit. I'm a star, got it, Hertz?  Rico, give these misguided clowns Tony Danza's phone number, and let's get the hell out of here.

Speaker: hertz
Dialogue: Rick. Wait! Only you can stand up to the radicals trying to keep Noxon from the struggling farmers whose very future depends on it.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Noxon? Wasn't that just banned?

Speaker: hertz
Dialogue: Only in the U.S....and Europe.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: But I heard that shit's lethal.

Speaker: hertz
Dialogue: Rick, Rick, Rick... You want proof? Fine. Just take a seat. Please.

Speaker: hertz
Dialogue: Meet the head of our South American research facility, Juan Valdez.

Speaker: george
Dialogue: My name is George Ramirez.

Speaker: hertz
Dialogue: Whatever. He's worked with Noxon 24 every day for five years, and he's in fine shape. Aren't you, Juan?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: Yes. I am fine. Me and my team in Santa Flan have--

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Santa "Flan?" What kind of shitty name for a country is that?

Speaker: george
Dialogue: It is named for the patron saint of creamy desserts... As I was saying, we've worked very closely with Noxon...

Speaker: george
Dialogue: It's ridiculous, I tell you. Totally ridiculous!

Speaker: hertz
Dialogue: Thank you, Valdez. That will be all.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Wait a second--

Speaker: hertz
Dialogue: Ricky, this is important. We're talking about a major threat to the EES image. How does 2 million dollars plus expenses sound?

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Look, it sounds great, but--

Speaker: hertz
Dialogue: I hear you. Make it five million--  that is, if the board agrees ...

Speaker: hertz
Dialogue: Good, it's unanimous. Well, what do you say, Ricky? Are you EES's "Man in Santa Flan?"

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Uh-huh.  Where the fuck is Ernie?

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: Ladies! All I wanted was a manicure! Yah-ha-ha!  IT'S THE COOG!

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: IT'S THE ERNIE! WOOF! WOOF! WOOF!

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Yeah, why?

Speaker: stuey
Dialogue: Rick! Rick! Look! I got a rare still from your high school production of The Glass Menagerie! Could you sign it for me? Please?!

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: NO!  Let's get the hell out of here!

Speaker: stuey
Dialogue: Rick! Wait up!

Speaker: stuey
Dialogue: Rick! Remember the speech you gave at the Actors Forum for Social Justice!?

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Leave me alone, troll!  That was before I got an entertainment lawyer.

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: Quick, down here.

Speaker: stuey
Dialogue: Rick! Rick! It says here Noxon's dangerous. Why are you lending your name to it? What's happened to you, Rick? You used to be good! And now... I just don't know...

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Don't cry, Stuey, I'm still good.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: ALRIGHT!

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: In the bag.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: AHHHHHHH!

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: You gonna eat your peanuts, Ernie?

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: Nah, you can have 'em.

Speaker: stuey
Dialogue: Hey, I'm okay!

Speaker: stuey
Dialogue: OW!

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Sure glad that wasn't our plane.

Speaker: protesters
Dialogue: EES mustn't stay! Take your toxic crap away! EES mustn't stay!

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: Jesus! We better find the limo before these whale kissers chop us up and sell us for parts.  There it is.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Wait a second...

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: Let's go, Rick. They're waitin'.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Forget them. I got a better idea. If I can just find the right disguise...

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: Coog, those hippies'll tear us apart.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Hey, how'd you like to make a quick hundred bucks?

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: He says the pants don't usually come off for less than two-fifty, but since you're so cute, he'll make an exception.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Here.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Help! Ow! Give me back my crutches! You monster! Oh, the pain! The agony!

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Are you okay? Let me help you!

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Thanks. Don't worry about me. What's one man's pain weighed against the global injustice of corporate tyrants like EES? Go. The fight must continue.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Wow... My name's Julie.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Josh. Josh Tavner.

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: Mother Theresa. Glad to meet you.

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: Ow! Hey!

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Give me those, ape. Help him up.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Hey Josh, a busload of us are headed over to Maracas to protest Noxon 24 and pelt Ricky Coogan with cow shit.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Same here! You could ride with us.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Us? You're with him?

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Oh, he's okay. Have you ever heard of an idiot savant?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Sure.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: That's Ernie. Except for the savant part.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Ooooh, my pelvis.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Is this better?

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: Hey Julie. You know I'm kind of an idea man myself. Like, let's say there's a nuclear war, and the only two people left are you and the Pope... Would you pork him?

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: But one thing's for sure. That Coogan guy sure is an asshole, huh?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: I'll say! What a total piece of shit. Don't you think so, Josh?

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Well, he's got a few problems.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: And what a lousy actor! I mean can you believe that "Hey Dude" crap?

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Well, with a script that bad, Coogan deserves an Oscar for coming off as good as he did!  I mean, that's what I read.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Well, he's no Christian Slater.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: SLATER!? I could act circles around that one-note hack! He was shittin' his diapers when I was the toast of Broadway! I made grown men cry! I made crippled children laugh! Now all I ever hear is Slater! Slater! Slater! WELL SLATER CAN KISS MY ASS! YOU HEAR ME?

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: You think Slater could improv like this? Make you believe he was an invalid!? Huh!?

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: So, do you like Swedish films?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: You don't even want to hear the truth about Noxon, do you, Coogan?  I mean, look, I'm not saying this stuff is going to turn anyone into a... a...

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Human worm...

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Right. A human worm. I mean, that's just stupid. The point is--

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Dog boy...

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Yeah, or a dog boy. That's absurd. BUT--

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Hideous frog man.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Okay, okay. Now you're just being silly. Human suffering's just a big joke to you, huh? You are sick, Coogan!

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Cool! A freak show! Let's check it out!

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Kind of like a family reunion for you, huh?

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: Lighten up, Coog, could be a goof.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Isn't it great? It's so "real"...

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Real stupid.  Let's go. This place is dead.

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: Yeah. Where are all the weirdos?

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Mutants, yes. Genetic nightmares, definitely. Children of Hell and twisted masses of living, breathing tormented flesh, certainly. But as for weirdos... not a one. Unless of course you count me! Ha ha ha!

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Nah, you seem like a regular dumbshit old redneck to me.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: I'm Julie. And you are...

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Elijah C. Skuggs, proud proprietor of Skugg's Fabulous Freak Land and Mutant Emporium. But you knew that. After all, you've ventured miles away from civilization, hospitals, telephones,  police... How may I help-you?

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Drop dead.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: We'd like to see your freak show. You see, only by appreciating the variety and innovation of nature can we come to respect the fragile complexity of our global eco- system.

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: And you come to me looking for weirdos?

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: Hey! What the--

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Ahem. Hello.

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Mr. Toad is my... assistant. As for the show, I'm afraid the next parade of deformity isn't until tomorrow night...

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Oh, just our luck...

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: However! I do have a private exhibit in my shed you might enjoy. I don't usually share it with the general public...

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: We're deeply honored. But no thanks.

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: Yeah. We really must be--

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: The sideshow tradition has been misrepresented by the media. You don't traffic in human misery. You show society the part of itself it doesn't want to look at.

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Yes... Yesm I see...

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: What the heck. We'll see some pickled dog brains, maybe some pictures of women with, you know, added equipment.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: And to think we could be in the limo with those stewardesses.

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: What the hell, Coog, these people are weird, but they seem nice enough.

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: AH-HA-HA-HA-HA-HA! HE-HE-HE! HA- HAHA! HE-HO-HE-HE-HA-HA! AH-HA-HA- HEHA! YAH-HA-HA-HA-HEE-HEE-HO-HA- HE-HE!

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: HA-HE-HE-HE! God I love the Family Circus! How do they do it day after day? It's amazing.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: ARE YOU OUT OF YOUR MIND!?

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Well, I guess they do use the same joke over and over. I'm just a sucker for that little moffet's shenanigans, that's all.  Am I crazy or is it hot in here?

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Behold! The Tasty Freekz machine!

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: My God! He's using Noxon Twenty- Four!

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Hey! You're not supposed to have that stuff!

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Oh? Well, I guess I'm not supposed to have these either!

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: I need only punch a few buttons on this magnificent device, and it gives me an easy-to-apply ointment that will mutate a perfect young body, bubble its skin, warp its bones and twist its guts into AN UNSPEAKABLY REPULSIVE, STOMACH- TURNING FREAK OF MY OWN DESIGN!

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Wait a minute. Does this mean we're not going to see a show?

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Toad, fire up that machine, and let's turn these hapless asswipes into monstrosities!

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Now let's see. Who wants to get freaked first?

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: Ladies first!

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Go screw yourself!

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: If I were you, I would!

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Hmmmm.

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: It's like Yin and Yang... AC/DC... two birds with one stone... Yeah, it's pretty darn good, really...

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Let 'er rip, Toad!

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: Wait a second. You're really gonna smear that stuff on us and mutate our body parts!?

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Correct.

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: Well... then could you give me a really big rodney?

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: I'm a mad scientist pal, not a miracle worker.

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Gumby! Put that thing away!

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Feast your eyes!

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: NOOOOO!

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: Well, at least I'll never have to go far for a piece of tail.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Pig!

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: Ouch! I was just trying to keep things light. Oh God! Why me!?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Mother always said there'd be days like this. And I thought she was nuts!

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: A mere party trick. But you, you're gonna be special.

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: You know her?

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Ah, screw it. I'd never get anywhere with her. TOAD! FIRE UP THAT INFERNAL YOGURT MACHINE!

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: For years I've strived to create the ultimate monster. The first of a whole new generation of superfreaks! Now I've finally got you, the perfect subject--a real asshole! HA-HA-  Wait a minute. Aren't you the guy from "Hey Dude Three-The Beguiling?"

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Yeah, that's me!

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: You were great in that picture! Oh well, I guess for the next one they'll have to get Christian Slater! HA-HA-HA!

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: This is Red Swan. May I speak to the Laughing Man?... Yes, I'll hold.

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Laughing Man? Red Swan. I've done it! I found the perfect subject-- huge ego, shallow personality, almost no moral values... A lawyer? No, better. An actor. Yeah, the guy from those hilarious "Hey Dude" movies! Hahahaha--

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Well, I liked 'em.

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Geez, what a grouch.

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Laughing Man? I have to go. What about the Noxon? Two days? Great, you can see everything then... Yeah, you take it easy too.

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Wakey, wakey. Time to meet and greet the new you.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Huh?

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: AAaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaargh!

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Oh God! This was my good side!

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Still is if you ask me! Hell, even half-done, you'll be the star of the show tonight.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Great use of the space.

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: I learned it all from Bob Vila.

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: You know you could expose those rustic beams and put in a skylight over one weekend, Elijah.

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Give it a rest, Bob!

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: One of these days I gotta put a shitter in there.

Dialogue: No problem. It's all here in my Beds and Bathrooms book, Elijah. And you pay nothing for thirt--

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Ernie? Julie?

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: Over here, Coog.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Are you alright?

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: I know that voice. That's the voice that said,  "Cool, a freak show. Let's check it out!"

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: What!? Oh sure, blame the woman. Typical.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: "It's so real." Is this real enough for you? I'm friggin' Quasimodo!

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: Chill out, Coog. You're talking to the original tag team of ugly pukes. Step into the light.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Okay, here I come.

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: ULP!

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Oh geez... It's not so  revolting. After all, physical beauty is just a socially-enforced myth that we, uh, oh shit... ULPI

Dialogue: Get away from me you, you...

Dialogue: No thanks. I don't plan on staying long. How many of you are there in here anyway?

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Huh?

Speaker: juan
Dialogue: Tell us, Worm, who starred in "International Velvet?"

Dialogue: Yes, yes ... very interesting... International Velvet... The perfectly appalling sequel to National Velvet, I believe. No dramatic verisimilitude whatsoever.

Speaker: juan
Dialogue: Yes, Worm. But who was the star?

Speaker: worm
Dialogue: Olivia DeHavilland.

Speaker: juan
Dialogue: Olivia DeHavilland... Rick, do you agree or disagree?

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: This is nuts. This is crazy... Besides, it was Tatum O'Neill.

Dialogue: Blast. O'Neill ... No talent ragamuffin...

Dialogue: How ya' doin.

Dialogue: And of course, in the center square, Mr. Paul Lynde!

Dialogue: Well JulieErnie, who will it be?

Dialogue: Call me old-fashioned, but I'll go with Paul Lynde.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Don't be an idiot.

Speaker: juan
Dialogue: You see, Rick? Just because we're freaks doesn't mean we can't have some fun, huh?

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Get away from me. Get away! I'm not like you. You hear me? I'm Ricky Coogan! I AM NOT A FREAK!

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: Okay Coog, so I get twenty four hour access to T `n' A, and you look like a plate of rancid giblets. We're still pals, right?

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: All the freaks have gone through this anguish, Rick. At first, I was blinded by my anger. I admit it. I wanted to break your neck for getting me into this. But I got over it. Juan taught me to channel my anger for the common good.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: It was your fault, anyway. You wanted to see the freak show.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: I THOUGHT I TOLD YOU TO SHUT UP!

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Ernie!

Dialogue: Oh... Sorry, Coog. For a second there, I was a total man-hater. Weird.

Dialogue: Here. Take it.

Dialogue: Forget it. Not me. I'm not like those other god-forsaken animals.

Dialogue: Heh heh heh heh hehh heh.

Dialogue: No. You've got it all wrong. I don't know anything about that. You gotta believe me.

Dialogue: Ho-ho-hahahaha hee hee hoohaaa!

Dialogue: Wow, what a great model!  But look, this one's crooked.

Dialogue: Sorry.

Dialogue: Alright, freaks! Get ready for the glamour! Get ready for the glitz! Get ready to be pelted with rotten vegetables, 'cause it's showtime!

Dialogue: It's grisly! It's revolting! It'll make you wish you were dead! And at just twelve bucks a head, you can bring all the kids!

Dialogue: Goddammit, kid! Would you sit down!?

Dialogue: AAAHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Oh no!

Speaker: biker
Dialogue: What the hell!?

Speaker: stuey monster
Dialogue: YOUR ASS IS MINE, SKUGGS!

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Uh-oh, that kid looks pissed. EYE AND EYE! KILL HIM!

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: TOAD!

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Looks like it's time to roll out the big gun.  Sayonara, kiddo. Any last words?

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Nahh.

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Suit yourself.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Wait! Wait!  Nahh.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: AHHHHRRRGGG!

Speaker: hertz
Dialogue: What a waste of twelve bucks. Let's get the machine and go.

Speaker: rick monster
Dialogue: TIME TO DIE, TROLL!

Speaker: stuey monster
Dialogue: Rick! Rick! Could you sign this!?

Speaker: the crowd
Dialogue: FIGHT! FIGHT! FIGHT! FIGHT!

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Give him the skull cracker, ya big goon!

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: No way! The skull cracker is an illegal move!

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Let's get this over with. Hey Hertz, tell your goons to  What the hell-!?

Speaker: assistant
Dialogue: Ahem. At this point in time we at EES regret that we must leave this performance prematurely.

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: What are you saying!?

Speaker: hertz
Dialogue: What we're saying is... get stuffed, yokel.

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: I figured I couldn't trust you corporate greaseballs!

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Let me proudly introduce the latest in our product line, Noxon 25--now available in a convenient pump!

Speaker: hertz
Dialogue: Bullshit! The Everything Except Shoes corporation releases no new products unless I give the order!

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: I think it's time EES branched out a little.

Speaker: alistair cooke
Dialogue: Ahhh! Head for the hills before he gets all of us!

Speaker: rick monster
Dialogue: NOW I RIP FREAKS TO PIECES!

Speaker: jimie
Dialogue: No! We're your friends!

Speaker: rick monster
Dialogue: Oh. NOW I RIP FRIENDS TO PIECES!

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Now that's a really, really big shoe. Ha-ha-ha-ha! Hmmm, I think I'd like a pair of those!

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Would you hurry up and waste the troll, please!? I got a lonely shoe over here!

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: And then...

Speaker: kathie lee
Dialogue: Sorry to interrupt Rick, but you've been talking for almost ninety minutes, and we've just got to go to a commercial.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Sorry.

Speaker: regis
Dialogue: We'll be right back after this, folks.

Speaker: kathie lee
Dialogue: And now back to the exciting conclusion of Ricky Coogan's incredible story.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Well, let's see, the other freaks were lined up in Elijah's sights, and I was about to shove a pipe through Stuey's skull, when all of a sudden, I heard a voice...

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Kill him! Kill him!

Speaker: cowboy
Dialogue: Your heart... your heart... your heart...

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: Atta' boy Coog!  Hey, ain't that somethin'?

Speaker: worm
Dialogue: Tosh.  Shameless, maudlin--Baaa!

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Cut the lovey-dovey bullshit, and start mutilating each other!

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Raarrrrrrgh!

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: You think I made you strong? HA! I've cranked my DNA up so high, you won't know what hit you. I'm a wrecking machine! Aaaaaaa!

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Ow! I think you crushed my spinal cord. I can't feel anything in my fingers.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Maybe you'll feel this ...

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Qait--if you kill me, you'll never find the antidote.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: What antidote?

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: A time release serum--I baked it into a delicious batch of macaroons.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: If you ask me, you skimped on the coconut!

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: Come on, Coogan! Come oooon! You haven't got the guts to kill me! Go on! I dare ya'!

Speaker: scrappy
Dialogue: Yap! Yap!

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Scrappy!

Speaker: elijah
Dialogue: AAAAAAAARRRRRRGGGGGHHHH!

Speaker: scrappy
Dialogue: Yap!

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Atta boy, Scrap!

Speaker: fbi chief
Dialogue: Freeze, FBI!

Speaker: chief
Dialogue: Nice work, Ricky. You'll get a medal from the Vice President for this.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Great. But how did you--

Speaker: chief
Dialogue: We've been following Skuggs for years. Scrappy just filled in some of the details.

Speaker: scrappy
Dialogue: Yap!

Speaker: fbi chief
Dialogue: Thank heavens you brought him to justice, Rick. God only knows how far his sick plans would've gone.

Speaker: fbi chief
Dialogue: Is nothing sacred?

Speaker: fbi chief
Dialogue: Oh, my Lord!

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: No! It can't be!

Speaker: elijus
Dialogue: Thought you killed me, huh?

Speaker: elly lee
Dialogue: What the hell are you looking at?

Speaker: fbi chief
Dialogue: Two pieces of deadmeat!

Speaker: ricky
Dialogue: And that's my story.

Speaker: kathie lee
Dialogue: It was so exciting!

Speaker: regis
Dialogue: And long! My God! It makes War and Peace sound like a warm up act!

Speaker: regis
Dialogue: It's fixed? Well, it's about time!

Speaker: ricky
Dialogue: That's better.

Speaker: regis
Dialogue: I'll say.  How 'bout it, folks. Let's hear it for Ricky Coogan!

Speaker: kathie lee
Dialogue: Can we bring out the other freaks now?

Speaker: worm
Dialogue: Ridiculous... Just because a man doesn't like macaroons... Nonsense.

Speaker: juan
Dialogue: Gotcha! Damn, it's about time!

Speaker: juan
Dialogue: Hey guys! Jeez! You look great!

Speaker: regis
Dialogue: That's just great. What a story. And what an ending! Elijah transformed by the goop!

Speaker: kathie lee
Dialogue: And he really looked like--?

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Exactly like you two, I swear. Same faces, same outfits, except they had these really big, hideous feet...

Speaker: elijus
Dialogue: Show's over, Ricky!

Speaker: elly lee
Dialogue: I'm gonna drink your blood!

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Rick! It's finally over!

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Yes... Yes it is.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Stuey!

Speaker: stuey
Dialogue: Look! I found the real Regis and Kathie Lee!

Speaker: stuey
Dialogue: This is Regis and Kathie Lee.

Speaker: audience
Dialogue: Awwww!

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: Oh, like that wasn't totally predictable.

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Well, now it really is over.

Speaker: rick
Dialogue: Thank God. You know, this adventure has taught me something.  When man starts impinging on the subtle perfection of the earth's natural order, the only thing he'll create is havoc.

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: Right, Coog. I learned somethin' too. That men and women truly are equals. That the human spirit transcends gender and physical appearance, and thus it is immune to the petty degradations men may devise. I believe it was Moliere WHO SAID--

Speaker: julie
Dialogue: Oh, shut up.  Let's go fuck.
